elements.title: Matooskie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1830 abandonment of Chipewyan woman Matooskie (pictured) by her Scottish husband was eventually settled with a dowry payment of £200?

elements.title: How the Red Sun Rose (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at least three historians asserted How the Red Sun Rose to have rendered outdated the scholarly understanding of the Yan'an Rectification Movement?

elements.title: Anna Nekhames (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before the age of thirty, Anna Nekhames performed the dual role of Venus and Chief of the Gepopo in Ligeti's Le Grand Macabre, one of opera's most demanding coloratura soprano parts?

elements.title: Femke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Femke is the most common feminine given name of West Frisian origin in the Netherlands?

elements.title: Humboldt Wagon Road (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that stagecoaches on the Humboldt Wagon Road could make a 400-mile trip in under four days?

elements.title: The Mongol Khan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although only one member was fluent in English, the cast of The Mongol Khan learned the entire script before the play's West End run?

elements.title: gig economy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "gig" in "gig economy" comes from the slang term for individual appearances by performing artists?

elements.title: a species of spider (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a species of spider is named after Barack Obama?
